And finally on inflation: It‚Äôs ‚Äúlikely to get worse before it gets better,‚Äù Mericle says. 

‚ÄúBut by the end of the year we expect core PCE inflation to fall below 3%, though CPI is likely to remain quite a bit higher.‚Äù

On employment, Mericle expects continued strength after significant improvement last year. 

‚ÄúWith labor demand still red hot and enhanced unemployment benefits now expired, we expect the unemployment rate to fall to a 50-year low of 3.4% by the end of 2022.‚Äù

That is in part because of diminished expectations for fiscal stimulus. 

While political economist Alec Phillips expects Congress to raise spending this year, the impact is likely to be modest and spread over years. https://t.co/UXU9N6kWl6
While consensus expects GDP growth of 3.4% in 2022 on a Q4/Q4 basis, Goldman Sachs expects 2.4%, U.S. chief economist David Mericle says.
